summary: [SPOILERS] Is Tyrion actually betraying Dany or are his Season 7 "plans"/"ideas" just shitty?
title: [SPOILERS] Is Tyrion actually betraying Dany or are his Season 7 "plans"/"ideas" just shitty?
body:
After finishing Season 7 last week I’ve read a few theories that Tyrion might actually betray Daenerys? I don’t see why he would do that but considering all his “plans” in Season 7 have basically failed (Dornish and Ironborn murdered, same with Olenna, then Viserion dies thanks to his stupid plan of getting a White Walker for Cersei, and then he makes everyone think Cersei is actually helping them when she clearly has no intention and actually plans to stab all of them in the back as soon as they march against the White Walkers). So maybe it was all on purpose? Or maybe it’s nothing and Cersei/Jaime were just one step ahead of him all the time, lmk your opinions. :)



Source: https://ift.tt/2LDRYJ4

summary: [SPOILERS] Fan-made teaser for the final season of Game of Thrones
title: [SPOILERS] Fan-made teaser for the final season of Game of Thrones
body:
https://i.redd.it/9chpmjy757j11.jpg

Today I want to present you a video I made after rewatching entire 7 seasons of GoT.

Characters of GoT has left us plenty of hints and rumors about the White Walkers and the Army of the Dead throughout the seasons. There were so many scenes with different characters that ultimately weren’t used for this video. I chose the best ones in my opinion to express the fear and emotions that I had during the last episode of GoT.

LINK TO WATCH: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JZMJtJriqps



Source: https://ift.tt/2wsmRvk

summary: Game of Thrones: HBO Releases First Footage From Season 8
title: Game of Thrones: HBO Releases First Footage From Season 8
excerpt: HBO released a promo video for its 2019 lineup, which included footage from the upcoming eighth season of Game of Thrones.
description:
Fans are eagerly awaiting the eighth and final season of HBO’s hit series Game of Thrones. However, while there’s still plenty of time before the show returns, the premium cable network has revealed the first footage from the upcoming season.

The footage is interspersed in a short promo video for HBO’s 2019 lineup, and while it also includes shots from Season 7, there are a few noticeably new scenes featuring Jon Snow and Daenerys Targaryen.

RELATED: Game of Thrones’ Ice Dragon Scream Is Actually Drunken Fans Yelling

Few details have been revealed about  Game of Thrones’ final season, aside from the fact that it will be shorter than previous seasons. Season 8 will contain six episodes, each one running two hours and directed by one of four directors lined up: David Nutter, Miguel Sapochnik and D.B Weiss and David Benioff.

Game of Thrones Season 8 will air in 2019. No official release date has been given, though it’s expected to return during the latter half of the year, despite earlier reports that it was scheduled to air in April. Either way, one thing remains undeniably certain: Winter has finally arrived in Westeros

KEEP READING: Game of Thrones’ Maisie Williams Bids Farewell, Hints at Arya’s Fate

body:
Actress Maisie Williams, who is known for playing Arya Stark in the hit American television series “Game of Thrones,” has revealed her love for BTS! On August 29, the English actress replied to BTS’s Jungkook, Jimin, and J-Hope‘s “Idol Challenge” post on Twitter with a string of hearts, prompting a fan to ask her whether she […]

title: [Spoilers] Do White Walkers bring winter?
body:
Or does winter bring them?

In the show, whenever we see the Walkers they are accompanied by an aura of extreme cold, darkness, and windy whiteout blizzards. Jon aptly says of the Night King, “he brings the storm.” Here’s why I think there may be a different explanation.

I don’t believe there ever been a time where we were shown for sure that winter is caused by the White Walkers. After all, they’ve existed in the Lands of Always Winter for eight thousand years, and winters have come and gone since then as normal. This current winter is unique in that the magic they are fueled by is stronger than ever before, and has amplified them (and winter). They do not cause winter per se.

I believe that the White Walkers are “following” the magical aura of Winter (Great Other) that is converging on the world. Another way to look at is when it’s summer, the magic of the Lord of Light converges on the world, bringing heat and sunny weather.

When dragons came back into the world, the scales of magical power were tipped and as a result this winter will be more severe, to balance things out again. The White Walkers are simply riding the wave, having bided their time for 8000 years and now being strong enough to attack. They had to wait for winter to come and the Great Other’s magic to be stronger, and it’s worked out quite well so far (RIP Viserion and Wall).

I have a feeling that if they were able to bring the Wall down in the Summer it would be a very different story. Presumably, they could. It’s still cold North of the Wall, and wights/White Walkers don’t decompose or melt that we know of. The mortal army would have visibility and not have to deal with the cold and hunger that comes during winter conditions. If only that could be the case.

Unfortunately we’re in another Long Night now so we don’t have those advantages. Food, cold and morale will all be huge issues. But I really believe the army of the living can still roll over the AotD with coordination and discipline. Just imagine burning hay balls like in Troy, fire catapults, wildfire traps set at strategic choke points, and armies in formation with proper weapons. And their trump card, the dragons.

They have a strong chance, if they whittle away at them and then just do a full strength charge straight for the Night King.

Please share any thoughts you have.



Source: https://ift.tt/2MZk99T
